Text.Value: I haven't sprouted a tentacle just yet - but I'm thinking it's only a matter of time.
There's no lie a devil won't tell, no soul it won't reap.
I propose an alliance. We search for a cure; I pledge you my talents, and you pledge me yours.
I'm placing my bets on a resounding 'no'. An innocent tiefling died by our hands.
I think you should go your way, and I'll go mine.
You can just call me Wyll.
I chased Karlach through the flames of Avernus. Her axe split the living and undead alike.
The honour is mine. Consider my blade yours, 'til death makes me lay it down.
I - no, my fellow. You've got it all wrong.
'Hero,' 'Blade' - names strangers gave me. My friends call me 'Wyll'.
Consider my blade yours, 'til death makes me lay it down.
*For a brief moment, you minds become one, and a single emotion rises above all others: doubt.*
Then goodbye it is. May the path rise to meet you, wherever it leads.
If I'd let Karlach live, she'd have brought the Blood War to the Sword Coast and set the whole of it ablaze.
She - she was a danger to the people, my people. What kind of man would I be if I didn't keep them safe?

EditorData.NodeContext: Unsure of himself, but feigning confidence

Text.Value: Are you sure we did the right thing, killing Karlach?
We've a lot in common, it seems. An aversion of devils for one. A parasite stuck in our brains for another.
How about a proper introduction?
A man of courage. It would be an honour to have you at my side.
Let's partner up and find a cure for this infection.
Excellent. If we ever become friends, I'll know what to call you.
Hmph - the famous Blade of Frontiers. Clever, this hero act you've got going.
You did the right thing. Another fiend, cast back into the Hells.
Apart, we can roar. But together, we'll thunder.
Some call me the Blade of Frontiers. Others, the Pride of the Coast, or the Protector.

Synopsis: Wyll recruitment after you kill Karlach in camp.
